markdown.markdown:
::: {.project-grid} ::: {.project-card data-target="project1"} Geospatial Intern, The Nature Conservancy - Alaska
::: ::: {.project-card data-target="project2"} #### Burn Severity and Vegetation Recovery Tool Geospatial Intern, The Nature Conservancy - Alaska
::: ::: {.project-card data-target="project3"} #### Bristol Bay, AK Wildfire StoryMap Geospatial Intern, The Nature Conservancy - Alaska
::: ::: {.project-card data-target="project4"} #### Devon Ice Cap Retreat, Velocity, and Elevation Analysis Master's Coursework
::: ::: {.project-card data-target="project5"} #### ArcGIS Wildfire Dashboard + Tutorial Master's Coursework
::: ::: {.project-card data-target="project6"} #### Literature Review: Remote Sensing of Permafrost Thaw and Associated Infrastructure Damage Using Very High-Resolution Imagery Master's Coursework ::: ::: {.project-card data-target="project7"} #### LGBTQ+ Youth Spatial Analysis GIS Certificate Coursework
::: ::: {.project-card data-target="project8"} #### Access to Green Spaces Analysis GIS Certificate Coursework
::: ::: {#project1 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project1" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### Wildfire Management Data App While interning for The Nature Conservancy, I created a web app using Python and Streamlit to make critical wildfire management data more accessible to landowners in Bristol Bay, Alaska. Users select the data layers and data format they are interested in and draw a boundary on the map. The output is either a tif file or pdf map of the data clipped to their boundary.
Key skills: Python, ArcGIS Pro, automated geoprocessing, data cleaning & visualization, creative problem solving Python modules utilized: streamlit, folium, numpy, rasterio, matplotlib, and geopandas [Click here to view the app](https://bbwildfire.streamlit.app) [Click here to view the github repository](https://github.com/azirkes1/bb_wildfire)
*Wildfire Management App interface* ::: ::: ::: {#project2 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project2" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### Burn Severity and Vegetation Recovery Tool Alongside the Wildfire Management Data App, I also developed Google Earth Engine code to help land managers in Bristol Bay, Alaska assess burn severity and vegetation recovery after wildfires. This code uses Landsat and Sentinel 2 imagery to calculate the differenced Normalized Burn Ratio (dNBR) and the differenced Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (dNDVI). In addition, I recorded a tutorial as this tool is intended for users who have little to no experience with Google Earth Engine.
Key skills: JavaScript, Google Earth Engine, satellite image processing, remote sensing indices, fire ecology [Click here to view the code](https://code.earthengine.google.com/57b233e295913b25d46a30bd0c9a003a) [Click here to view the tutorial](https://youtu.be/ZxnXXN5S_Vk)
*dNBR output for the Koktuli River fire, which burned in Bristol Bay, Alaska in 2022.* ::: ::: ::: {#project3 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project3" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### Bristol Bay, AK Wildfire StoryMap I developed an ArcGIS StoryMap to tell one story of wildfires in Bristol Bay, Alaska and house the Wildfire Mangement Data App and Burn Severity and Vegetation Recovery Tool.
Key skills: ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS StoryMap, written communication, data mangement [Click here to view the StoryMap](https://arcg.is/1KbTCD0)
::: ::: ::: {#project4 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project4" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### Devon Ice Cap Retreat, Velocity, and Elevation Analysis As a final project during my master's coursework, I measured the retreat of Devon Ice Cap with SWIR1 band differencing. I used Landsat imagery and Google Earth Engine for this analysis. I also analyzed global glacier datasets to investigate changes in velocity and elevation on this ice cap and created visualizations in ArcGIS Pro.
Key skills: Google Earth Engine, ArcGIS Pro, Remote sensing indices, and data wrangling, management, & visualization [Click here to read the final report]("assets/doc_storage/Devon_icecap.docx")
*Retreat of Devon Ice Cap 1987 – 2024. Total retreat measured is 617 km2.* ::: ::: ::: {#project5 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project5" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### ArcGIS Wildfire Dashboard + Tutorial For another final project during my master's coursework I built an ArcGIS Dashboard to track wildfires across the US. I then used this dashboard to film a tutorial about how to use ArcGIS Dashboards.
Key skills: ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Dashboards, oral communication, data visualization [Click here to view the dashboard](https://uw-mad.maps.arcgis.com/apps/dashboards/fb8c9c1e743c47a0a8154e1f0d8901e8)
*Wildfire dashboard interface* ::: ::: ::: {#project6 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project6" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### Literature Review: Remote Sensing of Permafrost Thaw and Associated Infrastructure Damage Using Very High-Resolution Imagery
I researched the use of remote sensing tools for detecting permafrost thaw and building damage, and synthesized findings in an in-depth literature review as a final project during my master's coursework.
Key skills: technical writing, interdisciplinary research, organization [Click here to read the review](assets/doc_storage/permafrost_lit_review.docx) ::: ::: ::: {#project7 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project7" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### LGBTQ+ Youth Spatial Analysis During my GIS Certificate coursework, I developed compelling visualizations of Trevor Project data to tell the story of how anti-LGBTQ+ state legislation relates to the LGBTQ+ youth mental health crisis. I created this map using ArcGIS Pro and Adobe Illustrator.
Key skills: ArcGIS Pro, Adobe Illustrator, Cartography, data storytelling
::: ::: ::: {#project8 .modal style="display: none; position: fixed; z-index: 1000; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4);"} ::: {.modal-content} [Close ×]{.close data-close="project8" style="color: #aaa; float: right; font-size: 28px; cursor: pointer;"} ### Access to Green Spaces Analysis As part of my GIS Certificate coursework, I worked in a three-person team to develop a PostgreSQL database and analyze US green space access disparities using ArcGIS Pro.
Key skills: PostgreSQL, ArcGISPro, database design, spatial analysis, team collaboration [Click here to read the report](assets/doc_storage/Green_spaces.pdf)
::: ::: :::
